image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from New York; born in Queens, N.Y., September 20, 1938; attended State University of New York, Stony Brook; Hofstra University, Hempstead, N.Y.; Franklin Pierce College, Rindge, N.H.; and the University of California, Northridge; served in the U.S. Navy, 1956-1959; electronics engineer; member, N.Y. State assembly, 1975-1984; unsuccessful candidate for the U.S. House of Representatives in 1984; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundredth and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1987-January 3, 1995); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourth Congress.

researchRecord.name: ca. 1975-1984, 4.8 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of George J. Hochbrueckner include correspondence, memoranda, reports, news clippings, and office files of a Democratic Assemblyman. The files were maintained on such topics as the Long Island Lighting Company, the Southwest Sewer District, hazardous waste, and ferry service. An unpublished finding aid is available in the repository.

recordLocation.name: Special Collections Department, Frank Melville, Jr. Memorial Library

parentRecordLocation.name: State University of New York at Stony Brook
